result.execSummary:
The defendant Montrel Romel Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. Court ordered all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments be paid by 6-30-15. If defendant fails to pay the monetary amounts on time, then the entire balance becomes due immediately and a judgment is to be entered against the defendant for the unpaid balance.  Collection can then also proceed under section 71.935 of the statutes as well as other collection procedures.

The first 25 days will be served in custody without release privileges.  After this initial period of incarceration, if defendant has no major rules violations, and is accepted into the Day Reporting Program, defendant may serve the balance of sentence with release privileges to attend the Day Reporting Program.  Court would have no objection to defendant being placed on EM while participating in the program.  Should defendant violate either his conditions of EM or the rules at the Day Reporting Program, defendant will serve the balance of sentence without release privileges. Court grants 5 days of pretrial incarceration credit.

Defendant may not possess a firearm at any time in the future; sec.941.29 Wis. Stats. makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted of a felony to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it its own 10 year period of imprisonment or $25,000 fine or both.
Defendant cannot vote in any election until your civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Montrel Romel Robinson in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Montrel Romel Robinson in custody.  Patrick M Harvey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the Court.  You are sentenced to 10 months in the HOC.  The first 25 days will be served in custody without release privileges.  After this initial period of incarceration, if you have no major rules violations, and are accepted into the Day Reporting Program, you may serve the balance of your sentence with release privileges to attend the Day Reporting Program.  I would have no objection to you being placed on EM while participating in the program.  Should you violate either your conditions of EM or the rules at the Day Reporting Program you will serve the balance of your sentence without release privileges.  Court grants 5 days of pretrial incarceration credit.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  The Court ordered all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments be paid by 6 30-2015.  If defendant fails to pay the monetary amounts on time, then the entire balance becomes due immediately and a judgment is to be entered against the defendant for the unpaid balance.  Collection can then also proceed under section 71.935 of the statutes as well as other collection procedures.  You may not possess a firearm at any time in the future; sec.941.29 Wis. Stats. makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted of a felony to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it its own 10 year period of imprisonment or $25,000 fine or both.  You cannot vote in any election until your civil rights are restored.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Jury in box at 1:37 p.m.  Jury panel sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Matthew Gadzalinski.  Exhibit 1 received. Exhibits 2 received.  Jury out of box at 2:26 p.m.  Exhibit #3 marked.  Jury in box at 2:44 p.m.  Court reads Exhibit #3 (Stipulation) to the jury panel.  Exhibit #3 received.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Michael Martin.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 3 p.m.  Defense motion for dismissal at close of state's case is denied.  Defendant waives right to testify.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of evidence is denied by the court.  Jury in the box at 3:25 p.m.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:52 p.m. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Tracy Boone and Paul Maliborski who were duly sworn for that purpose.  At the hour of 4:34 p.m. the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-01-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Montrel Romel Robinson in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Patrick M Harvey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  11:20 a.m.  Twelve (12) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled.  Jury out of box at 12:01 p.m.  Court recessed for lunch.
State's Amended Witness List received and filed./ds

Defendant Montrel Romel Robinson in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Patrick M Harvey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Final pretrial held in chambers.  Defense is entering into a stipulation regarding the laboratory reports and chain of custody.   Court approves the stipulation and finds the defendant voluntarily enters into the stipulation.   Court allows State to use eight prior convictions for the defendant.   Court rules on motions in limine.   Court orders witnesses sequestered.   Case remains set for final pretrial.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
Motion in Limine and Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions received and filed./ds
State's Amended Witness List received and filed./ds
Filed, State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection, State's Motion in Limine, State's witness list, and State's Proposed Jury Instructions. cmt

Defendant Montrel Romel Robinson in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a final pre-trial and Jury Trial date. Scheduling order signed and filed.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44 for Final pretrial and Jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed. cmt
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING (12 pages) commencing APRIL 25, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Montrel Romel Robinson in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Montrel Romel Robinson in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Step Nolten for Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.    Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #01CF1974 that are attached to the complaint.Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Sergio Rentis.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by random urine/drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Montrel Romel Robinson in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Montrel Romel Robinson in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
